snippet: The city’s Taxi and Limousine Commission said it had not authorized the use of any taxi apps for cab-hailing or payment, citing its existing contracts with payment processors.
abstract: Uber, whose mobile app helps taxi drivers and would-be passengers find one another, announces that it is halting its partnership with New York City taxis; company officials say that while demand for their smartphone application was high, business faltered because not enough drivers signed on, fearing reprisal from the city's Taxi and Limousine Commission over existing prohibitions on prearranged rides.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Taxi and Limousine Commission said it had not authorized the use of any taxi apps for cab-hailing or payment, citing its existing contracts with payment processors.

headline.seo: Its Legality Uncertain, a New York Taxi-Hailing App Is Shut Down After Six Weeks
headline.main: Taxi-Hailing App Pulls Out of New York After 6 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Its Legality Uncertain, App to Hail Taxis in City Is Halted After 6 Weeks
